revised_title: Exploring the Mechanism of Synaptic Inhibition by Noradrenaline at α2-Adrenoceptors
tldr: This article investigates the mechanism of synaptic inhibition by noradrenaline acting at α2-adrenoceptors in the submucous plexus of the guinea pig small intestine. The study finds that noradrenaline increases the potassium conductance of the membrane, leading to neuronal inhibition. This process involves the activation of GTP binding proteins and the opening of inwardly rectifying potassium channels.
